element.name: Samurai
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: The young man stands before a ferocious beast, his blade still sheathed the villagers look on in horror as it closes in on its prey. With a smirk the man draws his blade and in a few lightning quick strokes, the beast falls with a thud.

The experienced veteran stands before a group of bandits. Their untrained strikes are easily dodged by the man, as he delivers blow after vicious blow, punishing each of their failed attempts on his life.

A young woman wanders into the city, her identity hidden beneath her shade. She hears of the oppression of the people in the village by the local lord. She nods to herself, knowing she has arrived at yet another town which would be better off without a master.

Far across the churning waves, beneath the rising sun, an island nation gave birth to a prolific style of swordplay. These noble warriors were sworn to their masters as their protectors, willing to give up their lives to see their duty complete. Honour or death was a common ideal for these disciplined soldiers.

The Samurai are legendary swordsmen who lived by a code of honour. In service to the lords of their regions, they protected their lands with their lives and enforced their law without question. To do so, the Samurai nourished a timeless style of swordplay which remains mythic in its reputation to this day.

The Samurai draw on inner energies and an unshakable discipline. These are the tools which the Samurai built their reputation. To take up and master the katana is to enter a league of your own, though not every samurai has been known to wield the blade for a master, some choosing to follow their own code and travel the world.

When creating a Samurai, you have to decide how they became involved in the discipline. Were they born into the tradition, being the son of a samurai or lord? Perhaps they fight in a self taught style which they continually hone through their travels.

On top of their roots as a samurai, you must consider why you fight as a samurai. Are you on a quest on behalf of a lord, or directly protecting their master's lands. Perhaps they cast off their ties to their masters and teachers altogether and travel the world for their own gain, or the protection of the common man.
You can make a Samurai quickly by following these suggestions. First make Strength your highest ability score, following with Wisdom. Second take the Soldier background.
As an samurai, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per lowercaseclassname level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Athletics, Acrobatics, History, Insight, and Intimidation.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) an explorer's pack or (b) a dungeoneer's pack
a decorative scabard for your katana

tr.td: Samurai Archetype, Archetype Feature, Third Eye

setters.set: A samurai that uses a code of honor that synchs with their swordplay.
Light Armor, Rapier, one skill from the class's skill list

element.name: Artful Combat
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium
element.description: Beginning at 1st level, when wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

sheet.description: When wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

element.name: Unarmoured Defense
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium
element.description: Also beginning at 1st level, While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Strength modifier + your Wisdom modifier. You can not use a shield and still gain this benefit.

sheet.description: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals {{ac:unarmored defense sam}}.

element.name: Sen
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Beginning at the 2nd level, you have learned to gather Sen charges inside your body. You may spend these charges to use a variety of samurai features. Some samurai features require other creatures to make a saving throw, which is contested by your Sword Art DC as calculated below.

center.p: Sword Art save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

description.p: You gain the bonus action Focus. When you use focus, you gain 1 charge of Sen. If you are currently holding a charge of Sen, you double the number of Sen charges you currently have and then gain 1 Sen charge.
You can store a maximum number of Sen charges equal to your proficiency bonus. Your Sen charges fade after spending 1 minute outside of combat.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you gain 1 charge of Sen but if you are already holding a Sen charge, you double the amount of Sen charges you already have and gain 1 Sen charge.

element.name: Higabana
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Also beginning at the 2nd level, you have learned to perform the sword art Higanbana. As an action, you spend one Sen charge to use Higanbana. You make a melee weapon attack against a creature, if you hit, the target creature makes a Constitution saving throw against your Sword Art DC.

On a failure, the creature is grieviously wounded by your attack and at the start of each of their turns for the next minute, they take 1d4 slashing damage. As an action they may attempt to stop the bleeding by attempting the Constitution saving throw again.
At 5th level, when you use the Attack action with the Extra Attack feature, you may spend one Sen charge to replace the second attack with Higanbana.

sheet.description: As an action, you spend one Sen charge to use Higanbana. element.name: Code of Honour
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 2nd level, when performing Charisma ability checks on intelligent creatures which you know have an organized martial background, you have advantage on the check.

sheet.description: At 2nd level, when performing Charisma ability checks on intelligent creatures which you know have an organized martial background, you have advantage on the check.

element.name: Samurai Archetype
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 3rd level, you select a way of the blade. The Iaijatsu focuses on delivering incredibly powerful attacks, the Blademaster, who lures and traps his opponents in counterattacks and the Ronin, who drifts about the battle field, dancing through the fray.

element.name: Third Eye
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Also beginning at 3rd level, as a bonus action you may spend a number of Sen to enter a state of fierce focus. For the next minute, your weapon damage rolls gain a bonus equal to the number of Sen charges expended to activate Third Eye.

sheet.description: As a bonus action you may spend a number of Sen to enter a state of fierce focus. For the next minute, your weapon damage rolls gain a bonus equal to the number of Sen charges expended to activate Third Eye.

element.name: Ability Score Improvement
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

element.name: Extra Attack
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

element.name: Evasion
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or an fire ball spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

sheet.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

element.name: Studied Discipline
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 9th level, you have balanced your might with your mind. You may learn any two skills which fall under Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

element.name: Hissatsu Kyuten
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 11th level, as an action you may spend 1 Sen charge to perform a wide sweeping attack around yourself. Each creature within 5ft. of you makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take damage equal to your weapon damage + your Wisdom modifier, and half as much on a success.

element.name: Whispers of the Kami
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 13th level, you have learned to attune yourself to the world around you and listen to the spirits which surround you. Select two of the following spells: Augury, Detect Evil and Good, Speak with Dead, or Speak with Plants. You may cast either spell once. You must then finish a long rest to use Whispers of the Kami again.

element.name: Effective Meditation
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 15th level, if you spend hit die during a short rest, the next time you roll initiative you gain 1 Sen charge.

sheet.description: If you spend hit die during a short rest, the next time you roll initiative you gain 1 Sen charge.

element.name: Artisan of Combat
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Starting at 17th level, while wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

sheet.description: Now while wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

element.name: Midare Setsugekka
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 18th level, as an action, you may spend any number of Sen you have saved to a maximum number equal to your Wisdom modifier. You may make a melee weapon attack for each Sen charge you spent. You may not have moved prior to using this feature and may not move afterwards.

sheet.description: As an action, you may spend any number of Sen you have saved to a maximum number equal to your Wisdom modifier. You may make a melee weapon attack for each Sen charge you spent. You may not have moved prior to using this feature and may not move afterwards.

element.name: Meikyo Shisui
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 20th level, as a bonus action you turn your body into a conductor for Sen energy. You gain Sen charges equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You may only do this once. You must finish a long rest to use Meikyo Shisui again.

sheet.description: As a bonus action you turn your body into a conductor for Sen energy. You gain Sen charges equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You may only do this once. You must finish a long rest to use Meikyo Shisui again.

element.name: Iaijutsu Style
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: You have trained in the traditional Iaijatsu style of swordplay. You are trained in delivering deadly blows with great power and precision.

element.name: Enpi
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Beginning at 3rd level, as an action you may spend one Sen charge to make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30ft. using blades of wind. Make this attack and damage roll as though you are making a melee weapon attack. Attacks made in this way deal thunder damage.
Beginning at 5th level, you may make two ranged melee weapon attacks when you use Enpi.

sheet.description: As an action you may spend one Sen charge to make a ranged weapon attack with a range of 30ft. using blades of wind. Make this attack and damage roll as though you are making a melee weapon attack. Attacks made in this way deal thunder damage. At 5th level, you may make two ranged melee weapon attacks when you use Enpi.

element.name: Body of Steel
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can add half your proficiency bonus (round up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn't already use your proficiency bonus.
In addition, when you make a running long jump, the distance you can cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Strength modifier.

In addition, when you make a running long jump, the distance you can cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Strength modifier.

element.name: Tenka Goken
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 10th level, as an action you may spend 2 sen to deliver a series of attacks with incredible speed and focus. You take melee weapon attack against all creatures in a 15ft. cone in front of you.

sheet.description: As an action you may spend 2 sen to deliver a series of attacks with incredible speed and focus. You take melee weapon attack against all creatures in a 15ft. cone in front of you.

element.name: Hissatsu Kaiten
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At the 14th level, as a bonus action you may spend one Sen charge. Until the start of your next turn you add your Wisdom modifier to all weapon damage rolls you make.

sheet.description: As a bonus action you may spend one Sen charge. Until the start of your next turn you add your Wisdom modifier to all weapon damage rolls you make.

element.name: The Blademaster
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: A skillful offense may bring awe to a crowd, but it is a flawless defense which will keep you alive, or so a Blademaster would have you believe. These skilled swordsmen are patient warriors, preferring to dodge and counterattack their foes, rather than rush them down.

element.name: Hissatsu: Chiten
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: Beginning at 3rd level, when a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you, you may use your reaction to make an attack of opportunity against the creature.

sheet.description: When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you, you may use your reaction to make an attack of opportunity against the creature.

element.name: Nothing Ventured
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 6th level, your defensive fighting style and cool head have helped you learn how to best discern the location of traps. You have advantage while making Wisdom (perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks while looking for traps and hidden passages.

sheet.description: You have advantage while making Wisdom (perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks while looking for traps and hidden passages.

element.name: Mind's Eye
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 10th level, when a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you, as a reaction you may spend a number of sen charges to increase your armor class by 1 for each charge spent. You must declare you are doing this before the die result is decided.

sheet.description: When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you, as a reaction you may spend a number of sen charges to increase your armor class by 1 for each charge spent. You must declare you are doing this before the die result is decided.

element.name: The Worm Turns
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At the 14th level, you may take two reactions in each round of combat. Additionally, while you are under the effect of Third Eye, non magical weapon damage you take is reduced by a number equal to your Wisdom ability modifier and creatures you hit with an Attack of Opportunity have their remaining movement reduced by 10ft.

element.name: Ronin
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: You have cast off any ties you have to a master and have become a Ronin. Your sense of honour remains, but falls under no man's control. You are your own master and your fighting style has evolved to show this, allowing you to weave through battles with ease.

element.name: Hissatsu: Gyoten
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 3rd level, as an action you may spend one charge of your Sen to charge a target creature with lightning speed. Select a creature within 30ft. of you and move in a straight line towards them, stopping if you come in contact with an obstacle. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. After doing so, you may make one melee weapon attack with advantage.
You must travel at least 10ft. to gain advantage on the attack.

element.name: Rascally Vagrant
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 6th level, you have picked up some tricks of a thief in your travels. You gain proficiency in two of the following skills or tool set: Deception, Sleight of Hand, Stealth, or Theives' Tools.

element.name: Hissatsu: Yaten
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: At 10th level, as an action you may spend one Sen charge to deliver a parting blow on a creature. You make a melee weapon attack with advantage. After making your attack you move straight backwards 10ft. without provoking an attack of opportunity.

sheet.description: As an action you may spend one Sen charge to deliver a parting blow on a creature. You make a melee weapon attack with advantage. After making your attack you move straight backwards 10ft. without provoking an attack of opportunity.

element.name: Yukikaze
element.source: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium

description.p: 14th level, you've learned to discern holes in your opponents guard, allowing you to make more effective strikes. As a bonus action, you may spend one Sen charge to add your Wisdom modifier to your weapon attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you may spend one Sen charge to add your Wisdom modifier to your weapon attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
